content: A message was moved here from #OCPN 5.10 Release plan > OpenGL Issues by Alec Leamas.
Right, IIRC I might have encountered this as well (?) Still out of opencpn time, but should be able to look into this next week.

While we are on this subject, I hate the v5.10 way of handling import of locally built plugins while testing. I know about the arguments behind the redesign but I still find it tedious. The workaround of just copying the updated binary into place is unsatisfactory as installs also update other files.
So while developing a plugin, I revert to v5.8. There I can repeatedly import a local build and then choose Reinstall, which is not available under v5.10.
A message was moved here from #OCPN 5.10 Release plan > OpenGL Issues by Dave Register.

Some notes on the CF about no green arrows indicating updated master plugins. Both for O 5.10 and 5.11(master). There are CF reports for different plugins like Weatherfax and Radar.
I also saw the same on my W10 for the updated radar 5.5.5. No green arrow but an update was available. (See more below.)
On my Rpi ( on 5.11) there was though a green update arrow for radar 5.5.5.

I suppose this new behavior is caused by the plugins and the routine for distribute them and not OCPN since it's reported from both released 5.10 and master builds 5.11

The up/down-grade question is misleading. See the picture from a W10 (v5.11) where the manager asked for "downgrade" for radar v5.5.5 from installed 5.5.4-beta.
(Translation: "Nedgradera" = "Downgrade")

bild.png
